intro: Rapanea schlechteri, commonly known as the Malagasy holly, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically glossy and elliptical in shape. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue or black berries. Rapanea schlechteri is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
